member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.setContent
member.summary: Sets the content of the callout relative to its parent.
member.param: Key value pair object with names to bind to template.
member.remarks: Key names matching {@keyname} tags in the template will be replaced by its value.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.setPosition
member.summary: Sets the position of the callout relative to its parent.
member.remarks: The position will be offset according to the buffer property and alignment.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.checkPosition
member.summary: Checks the position of the callout if the contents has changed.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.startHideTimer
member.summary: Starts a timer that will hide the callout with a slight delay
member.remarks: This function is used for hover events to prevent hiding the callout because the mouse briefly left the trigger object

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.stopHideTimer
member.summary: Stops a timer that will hide the callout with a slight delay
member.remarks: This function is used for hover events to prevent hiding the callout because the mouse briefly left the trigger object

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.show
member.summary: Shows the callout

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.hide
member.summary: Hides the callout

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.zIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the zIndex of the callout.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the callout in pixels.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.content
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the callout

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.autoHide
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the callout should hide itself shortly after the mouse have left the callout

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.anchorPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative position of the callout

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.animate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the callout fades in and out

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent container of this element. Positioning will be relative to this element.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.maxheight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height of the callout before it will overflow with a scrollbar

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.template
member.summary: Gets or sets the callout template.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.templateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the url to the template.
member.remarks: The templateUrl should be set prior to initialize and will override the template property.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.arrowImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the url for the arrow sprite.
member.remarks: The image should contain four arrows pointing towards each their corner.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.arrowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the width and height of the arrow.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.arrowOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the arrow.
member.remarks: The offset is the distance from the peak of the arrow to the point where it should connect to the corner of the callout.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.calloutBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance an buffer distance callout position and the arrow.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.closed
member.summary: Raised when the callout was closed.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.click
member.summary: Raised when the callout was click.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.show
member.summary: Raised when the callout is shown.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.hide
member.summary: Raised when the callout is hidden.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.mouseOut
member.summary: Raised when the mouse exits the callout.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Callout.mouseOver
member.summary: Raised when the mouse enters the callout.

member.summary: Collapses the callout.

member.summary: Expands the callout.

member.summary: Associates a maptip with the given graphic feature.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.removeGraphics
member.summary: Removes the maptip from the given graphic feature.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.dispose
member.summary: Disposes the maptips.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.setContent
member.summary: Sets the content of the maptip

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.animate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the maptip should animate on show/hide.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.height
member.summary: Gets or sets the expanded height of the content of the maptip.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the content of the maptip.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.contentRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets a function that takes a GraphicsFeature element and returns an HTML formatted string.
member.remarks: The contentRenderer function overrides the contentTemplate.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.contentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets a content template used to format an attributes collection when the maptips is expanded.
member.remarks: The template is ignored when a contentRenderer has been set.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.hoverTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets a hover template used to format an attributes collection when the mouse hovers on a GraphicFeature.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.isExpanded
member.summary: Gets the expanded state of the maptip.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.expanded
member.summary: Raised when the maptip expands.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapTips.collapsed
member.summary: Raised when the maptip collapses.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.initialize
member.summary: Initializes the map control.
member.remarks: Must be called prior to using the map

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.dispose
member.summary: Disposes the map and cleans up.
member.remarks: dispose is automatically invoked on page.unload, and should usually not be called programmetically

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.checkMapsize
member.summary: Checks the current size of the map view for any change.
member.param: If true, will suppress the extent changed event if the map view size has changed.
member.remarks: If you manually change the size of the map element, calling this method will ensure that all layers fill the entire view and causing layer refresh if necessary.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.stepExtentHistory
member.summary: Steps back and forth in the extent history.
member.param: Number of steps to move in history. Negative values moves back, positive moves forward.
member.remarks: The map control stores up to the last 50 extent changes. Any old extents are discarded.
member.returns: False if it reached the end of the history collection.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.zoom
member.summary: Zooms the map around a given center on the screen.
member.param: Amount to zoom in on the map. This value may be adjusted to fit a tiled layer.
Center point to zoom around in map coordinates. This point will stay fixed during zoom If null, the center of the current view is used.
Specifies whether animation should be used for zooming. Default is true.
member.remarks: The scaleFactor might be adjusted to fit the closest pixel resolution if the map contains tiled resources. If the adjusted scaleFactor is 1, the map will return false and you should call panTo instead.
member.returns: True if a zoom was performed, false if not (no scale change). Returns undefined is the zoom was queued up.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.zoomTo
member.summary: Zooms the map, and centers around a given center
member.param: Point to center on the screen.
Pixelsize to zoom to. This value may be adjusted to fit a tiled layer.
Specifies whether animation should be used for zooming. Default is true.
member.remarks: If the distance between the current view and the envelope is too great, animation will be skipped.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.zoomToBox
member.summary: Zooms the map, and centers around a given center
member.param: Specifies whether animation should be used for zooming. Default is true.
member.remarks: Envelope will be adjusted so the map will fit the entire box.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.panTo
member.summary: Pans the map to center around the provided center
member.param: Point to center on the screen
Specifies whether animation should be used for panning. Default is true. If pan distance is too great (more than one map window size outside the current view), animation will be skipped.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.extent
member.summary: Gets or sets the extent of the current map view
member.remarks: When setting the extent, the extent may be adjusted to fit the maps aspect ratio and scale levels. You can check the extent property to get the adjusted extent after setting it.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.center
member.summary: Gets the center of the current map view.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.toMapPoint
member.summary: Converts a point relative to the corner of the map window in pixel units into map units.
member.param: Screen offset in pixels left of the upper left side of the map window.
Screen offset in pixels below the upper side of the map window.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.toScreenPoint
member.summary: Converts an absolute point in map units to a screen point
member.param: Point to convert to screen coordinate
member.remarks: Returns an object with the following properties: offsetX : Horizontal offset in pixels from the left side of the current map view offsetY : Vertical offset in pixels from the top of the current map view
member.returns: Offset point in pixel units relative to the top left corner of the map view

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.getGeometry
member.summary: Lets the user draw a shape on the map.
member.param: Shape type to draw on the map
Function to call on completion. The handler takes one parameter which will return a ESRI.ADF.Geometries.Polyline
Function to call if drawing was cancelled.
HTML color code for fill color used when drawing. The fill color will be used as fill for surface types with some transparency applied to it.
HTML color code for line color used when drawing. The line color will be used as outline color for surface types.
If true, keeps collecting geometries until cancelGetGeometry() is called or the mousemode changes.
The CSS style cursor name to use. Defaults to 'crosshair'.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.cancelGetGeometry
member.summary: Cancels user geometry input initiated by method .

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.addGraphic
member.summary: Adds a GraphicFeature og GraphicFeatureGroup to the canvas
member.remarks: Graphics are drawn from bottom up; polygons first, then poylines, and lastly points. Within each group, graphics are drawn in the order they where added.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.removeGraphic
member.summary: Remove a GraphicFeature og GraphicFeatureGroup from the canvas

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.clearGraphics
member.summary: Removes all shapes from the canvas

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.getShapeCount
member.summary: Gets the number of graphic features in the canvas.
member.returns: Number of objects at the canvas.
member.remarks: A FeatureGraphicGroup is regarded as one object.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.refreshGraphics
member.summary: Redraws the graphics on the screen
member.param: Force redraw of features already added drawn on the canvas
member.remarks: Features are drawn with surfaces at bottom, lines in middle and points on top, but otherwise in the order they were added.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.setKeyAction
member.summary: Sets the action to perform on the map when the a specific key is pressed.
member.param: Key to map this action to
Method to call when the key is pressed down
Method to call when the key is released.
When true, this event will fire continuous while the key is pressed down.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.removeKeyAction
member.summary: Removes the specified key action from the map.
member.param: Key action to remove indicated by the key code

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the current map mode

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the map cursor name

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.enableMouseWheel
member.summary: If true enables the mouse wheel for zooming.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.layers
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer collection the maps uses.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.spatialReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial reference of the map.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.disableNavigationAnimation
member.summary: If true, disables zoom and pan animations

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.disableScrollWheelZoom
member.summary: If true, disables zoom using scrollwheel

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseWheelDirection
member.summary: If true, scroll-down zooms out.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the map

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.dynTileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the map

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.progressBarEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the progressbar is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.progressBarAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the progressbar

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseDragging
member.summary: The mouseDragging event is fired when the left mousebutton is down and the mouse moves on the map.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseDragCompleted
member.summary: The mouseDragCompleted event is fired when a drag has ended.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseMove
member.summary: The mouseMove event is fired when the mouse moves over the map.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseDown
member.summary: The mouseDown event is fired when a mouse button is pressed down on the map.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseUp
member.summary: The mouseUp event is fired when a mouse button is released on the map.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseOver
member.summary: The mouseUp event is fired when a mouse button is released on the map.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mouseOut
member.summary: The mouseUp event is fired when a mouse button is released on the map.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.click
member.summary: The click event is fired when a mouse button is clicked pushed down and up again without dragging.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.dblclick
member.summary: The click event is fired when the map is doubleclicked.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.keyUp
member.summary: The keyUp event is fired when a key is released while the map was in focus..

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.keyDown
member.summary: Fired when a key was pressed down while the map was in focus.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.zoomStart
member.summary: Fired when a zoom is starting.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.zoomCompleted
member.summary: Fired when a zoom has completed.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.panning
member.summary: Fired continuously when the map is panning.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.panCompleted
member.summary: Fired when a pan has completed.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.extentChanging
member.summary: Fired continuously when the extent is changing.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.extentChanged
member.summary: Fired when the extent is changed.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.onProgress
member.summary: Fired when number of images in the requestqueue is changed.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.MapBase.mapResized
member.summary: Fired when the map detects a change in its viewport size.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Map.initialize
member.summary: Initializes the map control.
member.remarks: The initialize method must be called prior to using the map. It's automatically called when using $create to instantiate the control

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Map.dispose
member.summary: Disposes the map and cleans up.
member.remarks: dispose is automatically invoked on page.unload, and should usually not be called directly

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Map.doCallback
member.summary: Performs a callback or partial postback depending on it's postback mode
member.param: The argument parsed back to the server control

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Map.processCallbackResult
member.summary: Processes a result from a callback or partial postback
member.remarks: This method is invoked by the generic processor 'ESRI.ADF.System.processCallbackResults', if the action wasn't supported by the generic process method. Extend it to add additional server/client functionality to this control.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Map.uniqueID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique ID used to identify the control serverside

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.Map.callbackFunctionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback function string used to call back to the serverside control.
member.remarks: Executing the callbackfunctionstring will either generate a partial postback or a callback to the server, depending on the current AJAX mode. To perform a call to the servercontrol, use the method of this instance.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.initialize
member.summary: Initialize the parent along with any child controls that have not yet been initialized themselves.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.dispose
member.summary: Dispose the control.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.onDrag
member.summary: Invoked when a drag event occurs, this will determine the proper position for the handle and then use this to calculate the associated level so it can be drawn properly.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.map
member.field: Obtains the map control to which the ZoomLevel is a buddy.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.imgTop
member.field: The image URL for the "top" element of the control. Clicking this will cause the map to zoom in one level (if vertical) or out one level (if horizontal).

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.imgBottom
member.field: The image URL for the "bottom" element of the control. Clicking this will cause the map to zoom out one level (if vertical) or in one level (if horizontal).

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.imgSelected
member.field: The image URL for the "selected" element of the control. This image will be displayed to indicate the currently selected zoom level.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.imgDefault
member.field: The image URL for the "not selected" elements of the control. This image will be displayed to indicate the various levels of the zoom level.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.imageHeight
member.field: Height in pixels of the image used to indicate the currently selected zoom level.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.imageWidth
member.field: Width in pixels of the image used to indicate the currently selected zoom level.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.orientation
member.field: Orientation of the control. Use 1 to indicate vertical orientation and -1 for horizontal.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.dynamicZoomInFactor
member.field: When the control is associated with a dynamic map, only the top and bottom images appear and act as a zoom mechanism similar to the mouse wheel. This value indicates the amount to zoom in when appropriate.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.UI.ZoomLevel.dynamicZoomOutFactor
member.field: When the control is associated with a dynamic map, only the top and bottom images appear and act as a zoom mechanism similar to the mouse wheel. This value indicates the amount to zoom out when appropriate.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.LayerCollection.add
member.summary: Adds a layer to the layer collection

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.LayerCollection.remove
member.summary: Removes a layer from the layer collection.
member.param: Layer to remove from the collection.

member.summary: Gets the index of a layer in the layer collection.

member.summary: Gets the layer at the specified index of the layer collection.

member.summary: Gets the number of layers in the collection

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.LayerCollection.extent

member.summary: Gets the level that closets matches a given pixelsize
member.param: PixelSize resolution to match to (if X and Y resolution differ, X is used)

member.summary: Fired when a layer was added to the layer collection.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.extent
member.summary: Gets or sets the extent of the layer.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.imageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the imageformat this resource uses.
member.remarks: Format should be lowercase. Examples: 'gif','jpg','jpeg','png8','png24','png32'. The imageformat property is only important for handling PNG transparency correctly in Internet Explorer. Also note that for png32 images, image transparency is used and layer opacity will be ignored.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the layer.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.spatialReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the layer.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the layer.

remarks.para: The opacity is a value between 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).
Note that for png32 images, image transparency is used and layer opacity will be ignored.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the layer.

member.name: E:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.Layer.initialized
member.summary: Fired when a property of a layer has changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.getTileUrl
member.summary: Gets the URL of a specific tile
member.param: The method to call with the URL.
member.remarks: This function must be overridden by the specific Tiled Layer implementation

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.getLevelExtent
member.summary: Computes the extent of all tiles at a specific level.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.getTileExtent
member.summary: Gets the extent of a specific tile

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.getTileSpanWithin
member.summary: Gets the tile span that fully covers an envelope.
member.param: Envelope the returned tilespan should cover

remarks.para: The given envelope will be truncated if if only partially intersects the extent of this resource.
Returns [0,0,-1,-1] if the envelope doesn't intersect the datasource.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.getLevelByNearestPixelsize
member.summary: Gets the level that closets matches a given horizontal pixelsize
member.param: PixelSize resolution to match to (if horizontal and vertical resolution differ, horizontal resolution is used)

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.getLevelInfo
member.summary: Gets a levelinfo at the specified level index.
member.returns: Levelinfo at the specified level index.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.minimumResolution
member.summary: Gets the minimum horizontal resolution where this layer is visible.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.maximumResolution
member.summary: Gets the maximum horizontal resolution where this layer is visible.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.tileOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the tileorigin.
member.remarks: The tileorigin specifies the upper-left corner of the tile at row=0, column=0 in map units.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.TileLayer.levels
member.summary: Gets or sets the LevelInfos for the tiled layer.

member.summary: Gets the URL of an image covering the specified extent and size

member.remarks: This function must be overridden by the specific Dynamic Layer implementation

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum horizontal resolution where this layer is visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum horizontal resolution where this layer is visible.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.DynamicLayer.useTiling
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this resource should emulate a tiled layer.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Layers.DynamicLayer.tilesize
member.summary: If this resource is tiled (see ), set this value to control the size of the tiles. If this value is not set, the size of the map window will be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the a set of predefined resolutions used for this layer

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Geometries.Point.equals
member.summary: Returns true if the two points are spatially equal.
member.param: Point to compare this instance with.
member.remarks: Only X and Y values are compared. Spatial reference are ignored for this comparison.
member.returns: true if both X and Y are the equal.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.Symbol.cursor
member.summary: Name of mouse cursor to display on hover.
member.remarks: Use HTML cursor names. Examples: 'pointer','hand','crosshair','wait'.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.Symbol.opacity
member.summary: The opacity of the symbol on a scale from 0..1
member.remarks: Note that for bitmap based symbols that use PNG32 images, the image-embedded opacity will be used and this opacity setting is ignored.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of this instance

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.imageUrl
member.summary: Url to marker symbol image.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.imageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the imageformat this symbol uses.
member.remarks: Format should be lowercase. Examples: 'gif','jpg','jpeg','png8','png24','png32'. The imageformat property is only important for handling PNG transparency correctly in Internet Explorer. Also note that for png32 images, image transparency is used and symbol will be ignored.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.centerX
member.summary: Horizontal center of image specified as an offset from the left in pixels.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.centerY
member.summary: Vertical center of image specified as an offset from the top in pixels.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.width
member.summary: Width of symbol image.
member.remarks: The width can be used to resize the symbol, or in the case of clipping, specify the width of the clipping rectangle.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.height
member.summary: Height of symbol image.
member.remarks: The height can be used to resize the symbol, or in the case of clipping, specify the height of the clipping rectangle.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.clipX
member.summary: Horizontal offset from left of clipping rectangle.
member.remarks: Clipping is used for creating symbols using sprites, ie. parts of an image. To use clipping, you you will need to set both clipX, clipY, width and height properties.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.MarkerSymbol.clipY
member.summary: Vertical offset from top of clipping rectangle.
member.remarks: Clipping is used for creating symbols using sprites, ie. parts of an image. To use clipping, you you will need to set both clipX, clipY, width and height properties.

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.LineSymbol.clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of this instance

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.LineSymbol.dashPattern
member.summary: Dash pattern array
member.remarks: Specifies a dash pattern to use on the symbol. Dash styles are defined in terms of the length of the dash (the drawn part of the stroke) and the length of the space between the dashes. The lengths are relative to the line width - a length of "1" is equal to the line width. Example: short-dash dot dot: [2,2,0,2,0,2]

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.LineSymbol.lineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the line color formatted as an HTML color value

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.LineSymbol.width
member.summary: Width of line in pixels

member.name: M:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.FillSymbol.clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of this instance

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.FillSymbol.fillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color formatted as an HTML color value. If null, not fill is rendered.

member.name: P:J#ESRI.ADF.Graphics.FillSymbol.outline
member.summary: Gets or sets the outline of the fillsymbol. If null, not outline is rendered.

member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the rendered element
